root.title: MIK III 35a+b (TM 327) 408
root.store: Stored in Museum für Indische Kunst, Berlin, Germany.
root.description: Manuscript: Old Turkic. Paper: rough, light-beige. Quantity of lines: 12 lines and heading in front; 9 lines and heading in back. Characteristics: on edges of the text is lead the grey line; colon marks are outlined in red; lines 3-5 in front and a line 4 in back are red; heading in back is blue; the font is less in lines 4-5 in back; between lines 3 and 4 there is empty place.
root.size: Distance between lines: between heading and the first line: 1.3 cm; between lines 3-5 in front: 0.5 cm; in the others: 0.8 cm. 12.0 cm (height) x 7.5 cm (width).
root.investigation: L.Clark 422 claims that it could be a fragment of “Bilingual hymn (Persian and Turkic)”. W.Radloff 530 believed that it had been a prayer book fragment. Also А.Lе Coq 425 conducted researches.
